summary: The Achaemenid Empire, also known as the Persian Empire, was a huge ancient empire started by Cyrus the Great in 550 BC. It covered a lot of land, from the Balkans to Egypt, West Asia, Central Asia, and the Indus Valley. The Persians settled in the region of Persis and then defeated other empires to form this new one. They had a strong central government, respected different cultures, and built important things like roads and a postal system. The empire ended when Alexander the Great conquered it in 330 BC.
title: Achaemenid Empire
